from azure.storage.blob import BlobClient
import pandas as pd
from io import StringIO
from pyspark.sql.functions import md5, concat_ws
from sqlite3 import connect
conn = connect(':memory:')
columns = ["SIEBEL_SALES_STAGE_NAME","SSM_STEP_NO","SSM_STEP_NAME"]
sas_url = "https://adls4fsoetlhubdevuseast.blob.core.windows.net/project/sell_cycle_2022.csv?sp=r&st=2022-05-16T11:04:46Z&se=2022-05-16T19:04:46Z&spr=https&sv=2020-08-04&sr=b&sig=udm7PnviOcxI9VLp6Kuvyn9AjghiU1sAobpG7EdlNvg%3D"
blob_client = BlobClient.from_blob_url(sas_url)
blob_data = blob_client.download_blob()
df = pd.read_csv(StringIO(blob_data.content_as_text()))
df.show(10,False)

from pyspark.sql.session import SparkSession

spark = SparkSession \
.builder \
.appName("SparkUpsert") \
.master("Local[*]") \
.getOrCreate

df_csv = spark \
    .read \
    .option("header","true") \
    .csv("project/sell_cycle_2022.csv")

df_csv.show(10,False)

#import required modules
from pyspark import SparkConf, SparkContext , SQLContext
from pyspark.sql import SparkSession
from pyspark.sql import SQLContext
 
#Create spark configuration object
conf = SparkConf()
conf.setMaster("local").setAppName("My app")
 
#Create spark context and sparksession
sc = SparkContext.getOrCreate(conf=conf)
spark = SparkSession(sc)
#set variable to be used to connect the database
database = "sqldb-etlhub-confirmed"
table = "DBXDH.DHTS_SELL_CYCLE"
user = "sqladminuser"
password  = "try2find$5"
 
#read table data into a spark dataframe
jdbcDF = spark.read.format("jdbc") \
    .option("url", f"jdbc:sqlserver://sqlserver-kyn-001494-dev-eus-001.database.windows.net:1433;databaseName={database};") \
    .option("dbtable", table) \
    .option("user", user) \
    .option("password", password) \
    .option("driver", "com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerDriver") \
    .load()
#show the data loaded into dataframe
#jdbcDF.show()

from pyspark.sql import SparkSession 
from pyspark.sql.types import * 
from pyspark.sql.functions import when

# Primary storage info 
account_name = 'adls4fsoetlhubdevuseast' # fill in your primary account name 
container_name = 'project' # fill in your container name 
relative_path = '/' # fill in your relative folder path 

adls_path = 'abfss://%s@%s.dfs.core.windows.net%s' % (container_name, account_name, relative_path) 
#adls_path='https://adls4fsoetlhubdevuseast.dfs.core.windows.net/project/sell_cycle_2022.csv'
print('Primary storage account path: ' + adls_path) 

# Read a csv file 
csv_path = adls_path + 'sell_cycle_2022.csv' 
#csv_path='https://adls4fsoetlhubdevuseast.blob.core.windows.net/project/sell_cycle_2022.csv'
df_csv = spark.read.csv(csv_path, header = 'true')
df_csv.show(20,False)

#set variable to be used to connect the database
database = "sqldb-etlhub-confirmed"
table = "DBXDH.DHTS_SELL_CYCLE"
user = "sqladminuser"
password  = "try2find$5"
 
#write the dataframe into a sql table
df_csv.write.mode("append") \
    .format("jdbc") \
    .option("url", f"jdbc:sqlserver://sqlserver-kyn-001494-dev-eus-001.database.windows.net:1433;databaseName={database};") \
    .option("dbtable", table) \
    .option("user", user) \
    .option("password", password) \
    .option("driver", "com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerDriver") \
    .save()
